meanings.definition: The quality or state of being comical.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's comicality was evident in every joke.
meanings.sent3: The comicality of the situation made them all burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His comicality was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The comicality of the clown's performance was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The ability to provoke laughter or amusement.
meanings.sent1: The movie's comicality had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent2: She possessed a natural comicality that charmed everyone around her.
meanings.sent3: The comicality of the situation caught them off guard.
meanings.sent4: His comicality was a powerful tool in lifting spirits.
meanings.sent5: The comicality of the cartoon characters was endearing.

meanings.sent1: His writing had a touch of comicality that made it enjoyable to read.
meanings.sent2: The comicality of his gestures never failed to make people smile.
meanings.sent3: The comicality of the situation was a welcome break from the seriousness.
meanings.sent4: Her comicality was like a breath of fresh air in the room.
meanings.sent5: The comicality of the play left the audience in stitches.
